description: Number of orbits of length n under the full 13-shift (whose periodic points are counted by A001022).
comments: Number of monic irreducible polynomials of degree n over GF(13). - _Robert Israel_, Jan 07 2015
links: Yash Puri and Thomas Ward, A dynamical property unique to the Lucas sequence, Fibonacci Quarterly, Volume 39, Number 5 (November 2001), pp. 398-402.
Y. Puri and T. Ward, Arithmetic and growth of periodic orbits, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 4 (2001), #01.2.1.
example: a(2)=78 since there are 169 points of period 2 in the full 13-shift and 13 fixed points, so there must be (169-13)/2 = 78 orbits of length 2.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, moebius(d)*13^(n/d))/n; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 07 2015
author: Thomas Ward (t.ward(AT)uea.ac.uk), Mar 21 2001
